title: How to Make a Pie Crust Mix

steps.headline: Cut in shortening using a pastry blender, two knives, or your fingertips until the mixture looks like coarse cornmeal.
Store in a covered container in the refrigerator.
Single 8-inch pie crust:  1 cup Pastry Mix and 2 tablespoons cold water.
steps.description: Sprinkle the cold water over the flour mixture, blending to form a stiff dough. Shape into a ball. Turn out onto a lightly floured board. Knead twice to blend well. Let stand 20 minutes. Roll out to fit pie pan.

steps.headline: Two 8-inch crust pie:  Use 2 cups Pastry Mix and 3 to 5 tablespoons water.

text: Sift flour with salt.  Cut in shortening using a pastry blender, two knives, or your fingertips until the mixture looks like coarse cornmeal.  Store in a covered container in the refrigerator. Makes about 11 cups. Single 8-inch pie crust:  1 cup Pastry Mix and 2 tablespoons cold water. Sprinkle the cold water over the flour mixture, blending to form a stiff dough. Shape into a ball. Turn out onto a lightly floured board. Knead twice to blend well. Let stand 20 minutes. Roll out to fit pie pan. Two 8-inch crust pie:  Use 2 cups Pastry Mix and 3 to 5 tablespoons water. Follow above directions.
